main event: On January 3, 1957, a single unidentified object was observed for one minute, displaying red and white flashing lights and erratic movements before disappearing behind overcast conditions.
interesting points: The object was described as resembling a taillight,The sighting was made from 40 miles north of Springfield, Massachusetts,The object changed course multiple times but could not be overtaken for closer observation,The case was determined to have insufficient data for a definitive conclusion,The object was ultimately classified as possibly being a balloon.
sighted object: one red and white flashing object
witness description: a civilian observer who reported the sighting
